question.body: Which statement does not apply to amino acids?

multiple_choice.choice: They are building blocks of proteins.
They contain both an amino group and a carboxyl group.
They exist primarily in charged form.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Amino acids are the protein monomers, making them the building blocks.
Incorrect. Each amino acid does contain an amino and carboxyl group, which is where they derive their name from.
Correct. Not all amino acids are polar, several are nonpolar.
Incorrect. Both the amino and carboxyl group can commonly be found in charged form.
